XII.i.3.A.1.
c
.
Handling Claims
in Which the Claimant Is Awarded Less
Than the Full
Rate
If a case is encountered in which a beneficiary was awarded less than the full rate and an additional claimant, who was receiving benefits, is no longer entitled to benefits
adjust the claim without regard to the effective date requirements of
38 CFR 3.114(a)
, and
authorize the retroactive increase effective as of the commencing date of the award, but not prior to December 1, 1962.
Note
:  If the payee has died, benefits may be adjusted and payable as an accrued benefit.
Reference
:  For more information on accrued benefits, see
38 CFR 3.1000
, and
M21-1, Part XI, Subpart ii, 3.A
-
E
.
